verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Hew thee two tables of stone like unto the first: and I will write upon these tables the words that were in the first tables, which thou brakest.
verses.ct: The LORD told Moses, "Cut 2 stone tablets just like the originals, and I will write on them the same words that were on the first tablets — the ones you shattered."

verses.kjv: And be ready in the morning, and come up in the morning unto mount Sinai, and present thyself there to me in the top of the mount.
verses.ct: "Get ready by morning, and come up Mount Sinai in the morning. Meet me there at the top of the mountain."

verses.kjv: And no man shall come up with thee, neither let any man be seen throughout all the mount; neither let the flocks nor herds feed before that mount.
verses.ct: "No one is allowed to come with you. No one should even be seen anywhere on the mountain. Don't let any flocks or herds graze near the mountain either."

verses.kjv: And he hewed two tables of stone like unto the first; and Moses rose up early in the morning, and went up unto mount Sinai, as the LORD had commanded him, and took in his hand the two tables of stone.
verses.ct: So Moses cut 2 stone tablets just like the originals. He got up early in the morning and climbed Mount Sinai, just as the LORD had commanded him, carrying the 2 stone tablets in his hands.

verses.kjv: And the LORD descended in the cloud, and stood with him there, and proclaimed the name of the LORD.
verses.ct: Then the LORD came down in the cloud and stood there with him, and he declared the name of the LORD.

verses.kjv: And the LORD passed by before him, and proclaimed, The LORD, The LORD God, merciful and gracious, longsuffering, and abundant in goodness and truth,
verses.ct: The LORD passed in front of him and declared, "The LORD, the LORD God — compassionate and gracious, slow to anger, and overflowing with goodness and truth,

verses.kjv: Keeping mercy for thousands, forgiving iniquity and transgression and sin, and that will by no means clear the guilty; visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children, and upon the children’s children, unto the third and to the fourth generation.
verses.ct: showing mercy to thousands of generations, forgiving wickedness, rebellion, and sin. Yet he does not leave the guilty unpunished, bringing the consequences of the parents' sin on the children and grandchildren, to the 3rd and 4th generation."

verses.kjv: And Moses made haste, and bowed his head toward the earth, and worshipped.
verses.ct: Moses immediately bowed low to the ground and worshiped.

verses.kjv: And he said, If now I have found grace in thy sight, O LORD, let my LORD, I pray thee, go among us; for it is a stiffnecked people; and pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for thine inheritance.
verses.ct: Then he said, "If I have earned your favor, Lord, please travel among us. Yes, these people are stubborn, but forgive our wickedness and our sin, and claim us as your own."

verses.kjv: And he said, Behold, I make a covenant: before all thy people I will do marvels, such as have not been done in all the earth, nor in any nation: and all the people among which thou art shall see the work of the LORD: for it is a terrible thing that I will do with thee.
verses.ct: The LORD replied, "Pay attention — I am establishing a covenant. In front of all your people, I will perform wonders that have never been done anywhere on earth or among any nation. All the people around you will witness what the LORD can do, because what I am about to accomplish through you will be an awesome thing."

verses.kjv: Observe thou that which I command thee this day: behold, I drive out before thee the Amorite, and the Canaanite, and the Hittite, and the Perizzite, and the Hivite, and the Jebusite.
verses.ct: "Obey what I am commanding you today. I am going to drive out ahead of you the Amorites, Canaanites, Hittites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites."

verses.kjv: Take heed to thyself, lest thou make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land whither thou goest, lest it be for a snare in the midst of thee:
verses.ct: "Be careful not to make any treaty with the people living in the land where you are going, or it will become a trap for you."

verses.kjv: But ye shall destroy their altars, break their images, and cut down their groves:
verses.ct: "Instead, tear down their altars, smash their sacred pillars, and chop down their worship poles."

verses.kjv: For thou shalt worship no other god: for the LORD, whose name is Jealous, is a jealous God:
verses.ct: "You must never worship any other god, because the LORD, whose name is Jealous, is a jealous God."

verses.kjv: Lest thou make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land, and they go a whoring after their gods, and do sacrifice unto their gods, and one call thee, and thou eat of his sacrifice;
verses.ct: "Never make a treaty with the people of that land, because when they chase after their gods and offer sacrifices to them, they will invite you, and you will end up eating their sacrifices."

verses.kjv: And thou take of their daughters unto thy sons, and their daughters go a whoring after their gods, and make thy sons go a whoring after their gods.
verses.ct: "Then you will take their daughters as wives for your sons, and when their daughters chase after their gods, they will lead your sons to chase after those gods too."

verses.kjv: Thou shalt make thee no molten gods.
verses.ct: "Do not make cast metal idols for yourselves."

verses.kjv: The feast of unleavened bread shalt thou keep. Seven days thou shalt eat unleavened bread, as I commanded thee, in the time of the month Abib: for in the month Abib thou camest out from Egypt.
verses.ct: "Celebrate the Festival of Unleavened Bread. For 7 days eat bread made without yeast, as I commanded you, during the appointed time in the month of Abib, because that is when you came out of Egypt."

verses.kjv: All that openeth the matrix is mine; and every firstling among thy cattle, whether ox or sheep, that is male.
verses.ct: "Every firstborn belongs to me, including every firstborn male from your livestock, whether cattle or sheep."

verses.kjv: But the firstling of an ass thou shalt redeem with a lamb: and if thou redeem him not, then shalt thou break his neck. All the firstborn of thy sons thou shalt redeem. And none shall appear before me empty.
verses.ct: "You must buy back the firstborn of a donkey with a lamb. If you don't buy it back, you must break its neck. You must also buy back every firstborn among your sons. No one should come into my presence empty-handed."

verses.kjv: Six days thou shalt work, but on the seventh day thou shalt rest: in earing time and in harvest thou shalt rest.
verses.ct: "Work for 6 days, but on the 7th day you must rest — even during plowing season and harvest time, you must rest."

verses.kjv: And thou shalt observe the feast of weeks, of the firstfruits of wheat harvest, and the feast of ingathering at the year’s end.
verses.ct: "Celebrate the Festival of Weeks with the first produce of the wheat harvest, and the Festival of Ingathering at the turn of the year."

verses.kjv: Thrice in the year shall all your menchildren appear before the LORD God, the God of Israel.
verses.ct: "3 times a year, every male among you must appear before the Lord GOD, the God of Israel."

verses.kjv: For I will cast out the nations before thee, and enlarge thy borders: neither shall any man desire thy land, when thou shalt go up to appear before the LORD thy God thrice in the year.
verses.ct: "I will force nations out of your way and expand your territory. No one will try to take your land when you go up to appear before the LORD your God 3 times each year."

verses.kjv: Thou shalt not offer the blood of my sacrifice with leaven; neither shall the sacrifice of the feast of the passover be left unto the morning.
verses.ct: "Do not offer the blood of my sacrifice alongside anything containing yeast, and do not let any of the Passover sacrifice remain until morning."

verses.kjv: The first of the firstfruits of thy land thou shalt bring unto the house of the LORD thy God. Thou shalt not seethe a kid in his mother’s milk.
verses.ct: "Bring the very best of the first produce from your land to the house of the LORD your God. Do not cook a young goat in its mother's milk."

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Write thou these words: for after the tenor of these words I have made a covenant with thee and with Israel.
verses.ct: Then the LORD told Moses, "Write down these words, because based on these words I have established a covenant with you and with Israel."

verses.kjv: And he was there with the LORD forty days and forty nights; he did neither eat bread, nor drink water. And he wrote upon the tables the words of the covenant, the ten commandments.
verses.ct: Moses stayed there with the LORD for 40 days and 40 nights without eating any food or drinking any water. And the LORD wrote on the tablets the words of the covenant — the 10 commandments.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Moses came down from mount Sinai with the two tables of testimony in Moses’ hand, when he came down from the mount, that Moses wist not that the skin of his face shone while he talked with him.
verses.ct: When Moses came down from Mount Sinai carrying the 2 tablets of the covenant, he didn't realize that the skin of his face was radiating light because he had been speaking with God.

verses.kjv: And when Aaron and all the children of Israel saw Moses, behold, the skin of his face shone; and they were afraid to come nigh him.
verses.ct: When Aaron and all the Israelites saw Moses, the skin of his face was glowing, and they were afraid to come near him.

verses.kjv: And Moses called unto them; and Aaron and all the rulers of the congregation returned unto him: and Moses talked with them.
verses.ct: But Moses called out to them, and Aaron and all the leaders of the community came back to him. Moses spoke with them.

verses.kjv: And afterward all the children of Israel came nigh: and he gave them in commandment all that the LORD had spoken with him in mount Sinai.
verses.ct: After that, all the Israelites came closer, and he passed on to them everything the LORD had told him on Mount Sinai.

verses.kjv: And till Moses had done speaking with them, he put a vail on his face.
verses.ct: When Moses finished speaking with them, he placed a veil over his face.

verses.kjv: But when Moses went in before the LORD to speak with him, he took the vail off, until he came out. And he came out, and spake unto the children of Israel that which he was commanded.
verses.ct: But whenever Moses went into the LORD's presence to speak with him, he would remove the veil until he came back out. Then he would come out and tell the Israelites whatever he had been commanded.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel saw the face of Moses, that the skin of Moses’ face shone: and Moses put the vail upon his face again, until he went in to speak with him.
verses.ct: The Israelites could see that the skin of Moses' face was glowing, so Moses would put the veil back over his face until he went in again to speak with the LORD.
